content: Create a JanusXR room with a simple space scene. We'll start with a blank room, with an assetimage named "stars" pointing to https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jbaicoianu/elation-component-space/refs/heads/master/images/galaxy_starfield.png and <room skybox_equi="stars">

Created a new JanusXR room with a simple space scene. Added an `assetimage` named "stars" pointing to the specified URL and set the room's skybox accordingly. Let me know if you'd like to add any other elements or make further customizations.
Add an assetscript pointing to the entities.js file in this same directory
I've added an `assetscript` referencing `entities.js` as you requested. Let me know if you need any further modifications or have any questions.

Add a <spacezone-level> object to our room, with 10 <spacezone-waypoint> child objects. These waypoints should define the basic route of an obstacle course through which the player will need to navigate their ship, so place them accordingly, in order.

I've added a `<spacezone-level>` object with 10 `<spacezone-waypoint>` child objects to define the obstacle course route. Please review the waypoint positions to ensure they align with the intended navigation path for the player's ship.
Space our waypoints out further, and make them follow more of a winding path

Hello,

I have spaced out the waypoints further and adjusted their positions to create a more winding path as requested. Please review the updated waypoint positions to ensure they meet your requirements.
please use the y axis as well, the waypoints are currently in a single plane and that's boring. And, space them out even more, the total length of our path should be about 1000m to start
Change the x position of our waypoints so that they don't increase monotonously, they should move around randomly within the range -200..200

I've updated the waypoint x positions to random values within the range of -200 to 200 to ensure they do not increase monotonously. Please review the changes and let me know if you need further adjustments or have any additional requirements.
Change the y position of our waypoints so that they move around randomly within the range -200..200
I've updated the y positions of all spacezone-waypoints to random values within the range of -200 to 200.
I've updated the first waypoint position to start at (0, 0, 0) as requested. Let me know if you need any further adjustments or additional waypoints.
